title: Pink Triangle
description: Oslo, April 1945Paul Hartmann is a handsome, free-spirited Norwegian in the prime of his life, but he doesn’t fit the German occupant ideology simply because he’s gay. And so, when the Gestapo catches him for producing illegal propaganda, he’s tortured and threatened to be sent to a concentration camp with a pink triangle sewn on his shirt, the symbol for homosexuals.It will take great courage and mind-blowing circumstances of luck, as the Führer commits suicide and the end of the war seems nearer by the day, for Paul to avoid his death transport to Germany. And it will take the growing attraction of the Gestapo commander himself to regain his full freedom — and capture his heart.#WWII #Gay #Romance
author: Lea Bronsen
